revised_title: Atoxyl and Trypan Red: Experimental Treatment of Trypanosomiasis in Animals
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to find a therapeutical agent for treating trypanosomiasis in animals. They found that arsenic and trypan red were the most effective drugs. Atoxyl, a compound of arsenic and aniline, showed promising results in treating trypanosomiasis. The treatment was effective in reducing the number of parasites in the blood and improving the general condition of the animals. The authors also discussed the use of trypan red in combination with atoxyl and its potential benefits in treating human trypanosomiasis.
